Title: At least 23 dead due to heavy rains in Mexico
Summary: At least 23 people have died in Mexico due to heavy rains this week, local authorities across the country said Friday . Mexico’s civil defense authorities reported intense rainfall in 31 of 32 states, with the worst-affected areas being Veracruz .

Title: ASUU meets student leaders, give reasons for planned strike
Summary: University of Jos Chapter of the Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU) has explained the rationale for its proposed industrial action . The meeting, held on Friday in Jos, was convened by the union’s Students Relations Committee .

Title: UNILAG introduces 9-month course on election monitoring
Summary: The Human Resources Development Centre (HRDC) of the University of Lagos (UNILAG) introduced a nine-month professional diploma programme on election monitoring and administration . The Programme Coordinator, Dr Ben Onwudinjo, disclosed this at a news conference .

Title: Trump, oldest elected US president, in ‘excellent’ health -Doctor
Summary: Donald Trump is in “excellent overall health,” his physician says . The 79-year-old — the oldest elected president in US history — underwent his second medical checkup of the year . Trump saw physicians at Walter Reed military hospital on Friday .

Title: NELFUND reopens student loan portal for 2024/2025 academic year
Summary: The Nigerian Education Loan Fund (NELFUND) has approved a final reopening for a period of 48 hours to enable tertiary institutions to complete their student verification exercise . This is contained in a statement made available to the public .

Title: Air Peace expands horizons with new Abuja-London routes
Summary: On October 26, 2025, Air Peace will add the Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport, Abuja (IATA code ABV) and London Heathrow (LHR) routes to its network . The airline will also in 48 hours after add the ABV – London Gatwick (LGW) route . This will bring to three

Title: With Gateway Airport, Ogun flies to full potential
Summary: The Gateway State came alive on Tuesday as dignitaries converged on Iperu-Ilishan for the launch of commercial flight operations at the Gateway International Airport, GIW . From the ribbon cutting to the water cannon salute, the airport, decorated in shades of purple, sparkled .

Title: Earning Dollars made easy for Nigerians in 2025
Summary: Nigerians still grapple with harsh economic realities . Many complain of slow business, price of goods and services have gone up . As a responsible organization, our goal is to expose Nigerians in Nigeria and those in diaspora to various options that can help them earn significantly .

Title: Rufai Oseni and the courage to ask questions that burn, by Stephanie Shaakaa
Summary: Rufai Oseni of Arise TV belongs to that rare, unbending category of truth-tellers who refuse to be hypnotized by power or titles .

Title: Plagiarism: The silent crime that robs nations of ideas
Summary: The first time I saw my own words staring back at me under someone else’s name, I felt an ache I cannot quite describe . Plagiarism is theft. Not borrowed, not referenced, but taken whole .
